cyclone.name: MATTHEW
cyclone.current_location: about 35 mi ENE of Daytona Beach FL and 95 mi SE of Jacksonville FL
cyclone.trajectory: The hurricane is paralleling the northeast Florida shoreline, then is forecast to move north along the Georgia and South Carolina coasts before turning northeastward offshore of the Carolinas late in the weekend.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near or just south of Charleston, SC (closest projected coastal crossing)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Surf City NC to Cape Lookout NC
weather_observation.warning_coast: Cocoa Beach FL to Surf City NC
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northeast Florida through coastal Georgia and the Carolinas
weather_observation.wind: Hurricane-force gusts possible; sustained tropical-storm force winds likely with highest risk Friday afternoon through late evening.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Water rises of 6–9 ft possible along the lower St. Johns River and adjacent Atlantic coast near Jacksonville during Friday high-tide cycles.
weather_observation.rainfall: 8–12 inches of rain with locally higher amounts up to 15 inches may cause urban and river flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes in coastal rain bands; dangerous surf and rip currents affecting vessel approaches and pilot boarding areas.
